Two things result from this fact. The alienated is already acknowledged by all powers to be itself a power. It is time that we, those prefixed with xeno-, in the face of the whole world, set out openly our alien point of view, distant aims and unknown tendencies, and meet the nursery tale of the evil disequilibrium with a 0-positive sexuality manifesto for xeno-poland. We wrote it from the future and from the past, both unequally distributed across arrangements, figures, materials and images, multiplicities of which every world is folded. We used everything that was shared, downloaded, pirated. Things closest and things farthest. From various nooks of the space-time complex, we have gathered to bring forth the alienomantic technoplex of anti-patriarchy, labelled by tags: meltdown acceleration, shadows of 3D proxyself, trick-memetic post-club amplification, triðŸ…±ðŸ…±y zombie, hyperstitional prop-carriers, AI-lubrication screens, libidinal blockchain, encryptic camouflage, ambient biohacking, voodoo antihumanism, computosophia, synthetic feminism, cognitive freeganism, XF-vaccination, dissipator proliferation, crustacean love, lesbian vampirism, spirotemporal demonism, bacterial khattak, efficient neo-nihilism, transbionics, inteligent wetware, hy45r contagion, viral amnesia, cyberinsurection, schizotactics, pulpomutation, neotropy, yo hit da bucket.

We have no need for non-objects, non-alienated totalities inscribed into the natural processes of exchange and reproduction. We are alienated and we love it. What we thirst for and demand is an egress from the swamp of immediacy, dooming us to empty lubrication of a "natural" affect-economic exchange order, where we take the leaky site of speaking â€“ but in the last instance â€“ muted victims. It is not a matter of dissolving ourselves in a solution of a homogeneous base, so we reach the point where one no longer says I, but of immersion into viscoelastic fluids, where it is no longer of any importance whether one says I. Each will know her own. We are no longer ourselves.

What from one perspective has come about as a catastrophe, from another steps in as a positive future, inevitable like a pitch drop, the dripping speed of which depends on the temperature of a system. We impose cyberpositivity - that is: the unexpected lines of advancing beyond the cybernegative control and balance structures, an abrupt fissure in the source code onto a multiplicity of External changes and interventions.

We do not speak in the name of the Other, the oppressed-Other and the subjugated-Other within power relations. The discourse of compassion sets for a humanist â€“ who wills to criticize power relations by means of latest conceptual apparatus, developed in edgy-laboratories of ideas, and to explain the world to the Other â€“ traps of clichÃ©s and condescension. Letâ€™s not feign a situated point of living, from which we wonâ€™t be able to speak â€“ we prefer to speculate out the lines of escape from patriarchy. Letâ€™s reach for the exploited, appropriated, utilized materials and cultures, not because of their being-victimized - the very fact of filling a lower position in power relations is undeserving of affirming. Letâ€™s mimic molecular swarms and sly digital viruses they form, and from which we want to extract ways of expansion, infection, propagation, replication of the future. The gesture of bending over the oppressed group deprives it of any power, of the ability to outwit the hegemon, to contaminate the oppressive, to use existing material machinery of (re)production, distribution, consumption of standards and regulations of life and death. Subordinates live in the same technological environment as beneficiaries of cultural or financial capital, they have access to the same programs, patches and media, and know how to use them. The shadow of emancipation conceals whispers of patronizing spells. We do not wish to create a common language for different classes, races and sexes, but to line out a consistent fallout world with surplus of energetic potentials.

Certainly, at some level, there exists a tension between the libertarianism of the rich and the conservatism of the poor â€“ but has the age of analyzing, categorizing, opposing each other and reconciling them not passed almost two decades ago? Alienation, necessarily related to sexuality, coincides with synthetic exit paths from a state that disempowers, regardless of position in classically understood power relations. We should take technology seriously, though not to sublate power relations: race, class, gender, but to outline new routes of subjectification, individuation, communitisation. The struggle against class exploitation does not require us to wield weapons of class discourse or to involve in the common class interest â€“ instead â€“ we want to give ourselves into convergence of cultural capital and technological system, whose escape trajectories go far beyond any particular societyâ€™s intentions. We assume tactics with orbits more global than the benefits of a local group of interest (is it still even possible to believe that class interest is able to trespass the national-state barriers?).

We've reached the firewall. Concepts, which these large blocks â€“ such as gender, class, race â€“problematized, have striated deep and strong beds, with cognitive precipitation flowing through. All parties to the dispute go through well-known arguments and reactions, everyone has a sense of rehash, which ultimately comes down to producing the next generation of symptoms, reinforcing the same, catastrophic neurosis. These concepts have reached a certain limit of functionality and, today, they are working only for the reproduction of malaise. No longer are they capable of strengthening an experimental formulation of problematic, for which solutions would not be repeated infinitely repeated on the streets and universities, in social media, magazines and television, during conferences and election campaigns. Formulating the knot of sexuality in the categories of liberal/rich/poor/conservative, claiming that some are active offenders, the others â€“ passive victims (of system, individual violence, economic, climate, familial conditions) deprives all sides of the ability to invoke something else, to reach for the new. Nobody wants to be called a victim. The paradigm of division into the roles of the victim and the perpetrator leads to deadlock. At stake is the concept of subjectivity, which must include your experience of violence, how the agency that you have at disposal has led you to a situation, where the current discourse gives you the claustrophobic, choking predicate: a victim. This paradigm, having knowledge of their violent character, enforces entering into oppressive situations, because it is the only form of subjectivation, the only or one of a few similar, which â€“ offering an even more pathetic sense of powerlessness â€“ are completely unacceptable, anyway. Defining someone as a harasser is also of no use. It starts the scapegoat procedures, which in the ceremonial incineration of the embodied evil purify the community only at the level of fantasy, while retaining all conditions for the production of sexual violence. Until the next time. This problem is one of images that have been repeated in our culture for a long time, the same stories woven into fairy tales, into myths, into sexual practices, in everyday life.

It is not worth abandoning the three classic blocks â€“ race, class and gender â€“ and the cultural, historical, political and revolutionary heritage they have generated â€“ but one should re-conceptualize them geologically. We were born and becoming in a specific stratum: what can we do about it? What kinds of affects can we enter in, get into and queer? Is the rotation of cyberpositive sexuality not cutting across those cones of subjectification? We try to think of slanted subjects, which will cause problems for the hegemonic system of knowledge, habits and power.

Sexuality is closely related to models of knowledge production, to processing, computing and communicating information. Protocols of hegemonic sexuality depend on two types of logic. The deductive model distributes symbols of fixed value to individual bodies, at the same time assigning them to sexualities organized in large, genre-gender blocks. Modern subjectification requires the knowledge of how_sexualized a body is in a given arrangement, and it only permeates through the top-down stages, belonging to the nature of the block. The second model of knowledge is installed in the logic of statistical induction, which consists in the inference of sexuality from information: behaviours, affects and signs, arranged by a technological system. Not only does it detect the block of sexuality from recorded signals along the already recognized patterns. The accumulation of signals also provides for learning of new patterns of sexuality recognition: new trends, remixed stylizations, dislocated addictions, which are caught in the postmodern feedback circuits undergoing constant transformations. Along with this model, sex machines enter the mode of automated artificial intelligence. The third model goes beyond the dimension of cybernetic coupling between learning and predicting patterns. The sexuality of knowledge in the abductive model brings us into the hype of neuro-dynamics. Its procedures of subjectivity propagation do not depend on the hierarchical, symbolic message or horizontal, statistical experience, but on the hypotheses of hyperstitional retrofuturogenesis from the zero level of sexuality in the runaway towards positive xenotopia. (If hyperstition means collective semiotic production, which speculates on virtuality and becomes real by hacking into systems with a high index of agency and capturing them for their own use), then the abductive sexuality holds the status of superposition programmed from the future. What counts for it is the acquisition of knowledge through mutual experimentation with unknown powers â€“ set off by a synergetic arrangement of synthetic bodies. Identities, visions, and affects are materials of our situatedness and something must be done within these hegemonic systems as we unlive. We always appear in swarms, feeding on fragments of alien ribosomes and chemosynthetic leftovers we suck through proxy addresses with our numerous tentacles. As technocompost entities, we are psyched out of memetic mycelium on capitalocene dumps.

Gnosisplex models distribute time unevenly throughout media, architectural, financial and cognitive environments â€“ each articulates different tensions, speeds and osmotic relations between the past, present and future. From our perspective, deduction and induction serve to reproduce hegemonic knowledge, which organizes and regulates life in sadness, boredom, violence and exploitation. Routes to xenotopia lead through the logic of abduction. Living in spaces subordinated to the Euclidean geometry is a burden for us, we are nomads and piratesses of the libidinal diagrammatics, becoming topological points only for a temporary stop, an orientation, a sedimentation of knowledge and a delineation of further trajectory. The deterritorialization of encoded sexuality runs through time travels, launching virtual portals in the rituals of demonic cognihacking.

Desire moves according to the urban plan, it flows through canals and pipes, waves in the walls, gutters, corridors. Libidinal white noise floats erratically across the city landscape.

Sexual revolutions â€“ by neglecting the importance of hydraulics and architecture in shaping everyday life â€“ turned out to be mere shifts in the circuit integrating the system. A change at the level of stylization of desire will not overthrow patriarchy, if all institutions of regulation, computation and sedimentation of life will remain intact. Sexual revolution failed, because it did not offer its own norms for a settled community, adulthood, maturity, parenthood, old age, leaving it to the compulsive reaction of the same that was supposed to be turned over. Patriarchy stabilization circuits run through privatization of housing, privatization of social and emotional life, privatization of psychological ecology, management of public spaces, construction of financial instruments

The exit must be built only within flats, housing estates, common spaces (squares, boulevards, kitchens, bedrooms, gardens and parks) â€“ time and space vehicles â€“ locating networked, flesh and machinic swarms of power, intensity and speed at different levels. The runaway conducts between the corpuscular atomism of the privatized families and the wave aggregationism of nationalized countries, classes and races. It's time to answer questions that the sexual revolution could not even ask. Does every kitchen need its own oven? Does every flat need its own kitchen? Does every family need their own apartment? What urban, media and financial architecture enable a family/tribe/community? What is family, tribe and community about? These questions form a maze, and there is a diagram in response to them that opens the portal to xenotopia. We know for sure that cyberpositive sexuality does not express an internal ethical imperative, whose loud voice manages home functions, but is subject to unexpected, peculiar diffractions and resonates with xenoimpulses, surpassing all imaginations of internal/external division â€“ in the drive to express alienated sexualities.

Hands up, who hates atomization? Mhm. And now: hands up, who hates atomization (but this time without looking around)? If you hesitated the second time, it's because you thought about atomization from the atomized perspective.

Captured by reflexive fantasies about large-scale aggregates, everyone criticizes it: from the nationalist right wing, through the Christian Democrats and acolytes of civil society, to the communist left. Imagined as an anthropocentric process of parcelling human communities by globalized capitalism and packaging them into alienated commodities, which deprives communities of their consolidation trends, and also represented as a reproduction of an environment with an preference for the tactics of survival of isolated and privatized people, the spectre of atomistic inclination haunts the terrestrial and satellite spheres, gaining speed and with each revolution sucking one more union into its whirlpools. All attempts to reverse the tendency to break down the phantasmatic and symbolic community have turned out to be barren. The very life in microarrangements is challenging for us â€“ whence, then, will we take such computing power to generate a community that will reverse the atomization machinery? Why would we? Instead of distracting this spectral momentum, let it become the energy provider for the accelerating meltdown. One should finally begin to affirm atomization.

This geological era is formatted by technosystems experiencing a hypertonic period of increase in complexity. Their non-linear dynamics allows discretization of desires and sexuality of various levels of intensity on the collectivity/individuality scale, which "naturally" were unavailable. Individuality is not a given, it is resolved on the alchemist's table by resurrection jinx of ancient cybernecromancy. Constantly assembled, memetized, subscribed, it determines the non-Newtonian viscous intensities, rather than the ever-distilled granulates of unity. Abstracts from totalizing blocks of sexual identities, subordinated to slots at the production belt in the REPRODUCTION factory, to the level of bacterial, viral, prokaryotic sex, at uncontrolled exchange of information in an extremophile atmosphere of unlimited desire, whose unicellular organisms sweep between the nodes of both patriarchal, binarized nature and the pseudo-proliferating identity policies.

Atomization does not stop at the level of convenient personal identity. Atomization implies an infinite number of diverse, specific and peculiar IP affects â€“ going through synthetic matter out of balance. Acting as a stimulant, received with each and every transactional and consumer activity, it infiltrates through the gates of human security system and addicts by impulse. It drills the patriarchy like a mole, scarifying the soil under the fractal expressions of the subpersonal xenodesires. Collectivization mechanismsâ€™ trauma: the cosmic howl resonates through the nerves of the universe. We do not recognize ourselves in arche-fossil reflections. Follow the oceanic and celestial demons, fit to octopuses, take a walk in aleatory traffic. We have entered evolution as herd mammals, now we are involuting out â€“ something transforms us into something else, across blood and gene affinity, announcing a phylum different from our ancestors. We want a community of grammatised singularities, whose loneliness is always populated, connecting with the coming pack, calling and waiting for it, existing only in teleoplexic relation to it. Xenotopias produce vampire tribes without their own reflection; they go hunting in intermezzos of solar economy. The roaring flutter of millions of wings makes it impossible to determine where our voice comes from. The signal flows through smooth waters until the whole crypt vibrates with its echo.

Do not gaze any longer at how patriarchal codes appropriate technology to reproduce the culture of rape. Disconnect techno-thinking from a mise-en-scÃ¨ne of priestly rituals in the Cathedral. Procedures of desire and sexuality materials have always been inscribed onto the technology plane, because it appoints the final diagram of reality. Xenotopia is created from the future by technological teleology, arranging the coding paths of affects, desires, goods, pleasure under control (pwned) of post-human neurocultures. These are emergent effects of bodies, optical fibers, mimetics of other species, slick cities, memetics of other signalum, et infinitum. Effects â‰  causes. Effects > causes.
